Statement: After the 2001 and 2003 Bush tax rate cuts ... there was more money coming into the treasury.

Statement: Wisconsins "rainy day fund" is "165 times bigger than when we first took office."

Speaker: Scott Walker

Speaker: Scott Walker
Statement: Wisconsin is #1 in the Midwest for personal income growth over the year.

Statement: Once our Blueprint for Prosperity is signed into law, we will have delivered $2 billion in tax relief.

Statement: During my eight years as county executive, we cut the number of county workers by 20 percent.

Speaker: Scott Walker
Statement: Our pension system is the only one in the country thats 100 percent funded.
PolitiFact explanations: Badger State stands alone

Speaker: Scott Walker
Statement: Wisconsin is called the Badger State because "our ancestors came here with the hopes of living the American dream by mining."

Statement: Says Milwaukee County spent over $170,000 in salaries in 2010 for employees to "participate in union activities such as collective bargaining."

Statement: Most federal employees do not have collective bargaining for benefits, nor for pay.

Statement: In 2009, Democratic Wisconsin state senators "rammed through a billion-dollar tax hike in 24 hours with no public input."
PolitiFact explanations: When Democrats passed their budget repair bill, things moved lightning fast

Speaker: Scott Walker
Statement: Most state employees could pay twice as much toward their health care premiums and it would still be half the national average
PolitiFact explanations: The governors health care math adds up

Speaker: Scott Walker
Statement: Since being elected in 2002, Scott Walker has "given back over $370,000 of his salary to the county."

Speaker: Scott Walker
Statement: Says he "turned down a Medicaid expansion under Obamacare," but because of actions he took, for the first time in Wisconsin's history "everyone living in poverty is covered under Medicaid."

Speaker: Scott Walker
Statement: The rate in which people are working (in Wisconsin) is almost five points higher than it is nationally.
PolitiFact explanations: Yes, though it's long been that way

Speaker: Scott Walker
Statement: Wisconsin's pension system is the "only one fully funded in the country."
PolitiFact explanations: South Dakota has joined Wisconsin

Speaker: Scott Walker
Statement: Our last budget committed the highest level of need-based financial aid in state history.
PolitiFact explanations: Yes, thanks in part to a predecessors program he discontinued

Speaker: Scott Walker
Statement: Says because of his actions, Wisconsin "property taxes today are lower than they were four years ago."
PolitiFact explanations: Yes, though slumping housing market played a role

Speaker: Scott Walker
Statement: Says "Hillary Clinton's rejection of efforts to make it easier to vote and harder to cheat not only defies logic, but the will of the majority of Americans."
PolitiFact explanations: The laws are very popular

Speaker: Scott Walker
Statement: For our next two years in my state, we will end with a structural surplus of $499 million.
PolitiFact explanations: Positive signs but prediction a bit premature

Speaker: Scott Walker
Statement: More than any Republican governor in the 2014 elections, "I took a higher percentage of the Republican vote"and "yet I also carried independents by 12 points."
PolitiFact explanations: A notch off on both counts

Speaker: Scott Walker
Statement: Borrowing in my 2015-17 state budget is less than half that in my predecessors last budget and "the lowest it has been in a decade."
PolitiFact explanations: Lawmakers could push it lower

Speaker: Scott Walker
Statement: The gender gap in his support is "not unique to me" and "theres not a huge gap from where Republicans have been in presidential, gubernatorial and US Senate elections" in recent years.

Speaker: Scott Walker
Statement: Says his promise of 250,000 new private sector jobs was a "big goal."
PolitiFact explanations: A look at statistics shows it was far from a lock

Speaker: Scott Walker
Statement: Figures for September 2014s job growth in Wisconsin mark the "largest private-sector job creation we've had in the month of September in more than a decade"

Speaker: Scott Walker
Statement: More than 70,000 job openings are listed on a state jobs website.
PolitiFact explanations: Yes, though not all in Wisconsin

Speaker: Scott Walker
Statement: Thanks to our reforms, the average family will have an extra $322 to spend.
PolitiFact explanations: Being a homeowner is key

Speaker: Scott Walker
Statement: Says Mary Burkes Madison school district "will be the only school district left in the state" to "ignore the (Act 10) law" in the 2015-16 school year.

Speaker: Scott Walker
Statement: In the latest jobs numbers Wisconsin "ranked third in the Midwest."
PolitiFact explanations: In raw numbers, for last 12 months, yes.

Speaker: Scott Walker
Statement: Says he "invested over $100 million in worker training."
PolitiFact explanations: Yes, but first budget cut tech school funding

Speaker: Scott Walker
Statement: Says his "Act 10 reforms" have "saved the taxpayers some $3 billion."
PolitiFact explanations: Yes, with shift to public employees (who also pay taxes)

Speaker: Scott Walker
Statement: (Mary) Burkes company, Trek Bicycles, "makes 99% of their bikes overseas."
PolitiFact explanations: China, Holland, Germany

Statement: As Jim Doyles Commerce secretary, Mary Burke spent $12.5 million dollars to buy a vacant lot for a company that said it had no plans to create jobs in Wisconsin and had laid off 800 workers.

Speaker: Scott Walker
Statement: We in this state saw more job creation in the last three years since I've been governor than you saw in the whole eight years of Doyles time as governor.

Speaker: Scott Walker
Statement: Graduation and third-grade reading scores are up in the state since I took office.
PolitiFact explanations: Part of report card improving

Speaker: Scott Walker
Statement: In 2013 we had the largest, the best, private sector job growth weve had in this state since the 1990s.
PolitiFact explanations: Accurate, but not final

Speaker: Scott Walker
Statement: With the tax controls we already put in place, property taxes on a typical home in December of 2014 will actually be lower than they were in December of 2010.
PolitiFact explanations: Projection based on solid evidence

Speaker: Scott Walker
Statement: After years of 5.5 percent average tuition increases, we now have a two-year tuition freeze for the first time in the history of the UW System.

Speaker: Scott Walker
Statement: Even after collective bargaining reforms, most Wisconsin public employees "are still paying about 12 to 13 percent" of their health insurance premiums, while most state residents who work in the private sector "pay 20 to 25 percent."

Speaker: Scott Walker
Statement: The national debt is on track to double during Obamas presidency.
PolitiFact explanations: Blame is shared, trend is clear

Speaker: Scott Walker
Statement: Were importing about 10 percent of our milk supply. Were Americas Dairyland, but yet we dont have enough milk in this state to meet the demand for our cheesemakers.

Statement: In Wisconsin, only half of all the adults with serious psychological distress received mental health treatment or medication.

Statement: Two-thirds of Wisconsinites receiving unemployment checks "are not required to search for work due to current work search exemptions."

Statement: Nearly a quarter of all adults in this state have some college credit without a degree.

Speaker: Scott Walker
Statement: Weve seen property taxes go down for the first time in 12 years on a median valued home.
PolitiFact explanations: Not lower for everyone, but median-value measure is on target

Speaker: Scott Walker
Statement: Says Wisconsin Democrats during the previous administration adopted "double-digit tax increases."

Speaker: Scott Walker
Statement: Wisconsin state and local government workers pay "$500, $600 or in some cases, $1,000" per year in union dues.

Statement: If public employees dont pay more for benefits starting April 1, 2011, "the equivalent" is 1,500 state employee layoffs by June 30, 2011 and 10,000 to 12,000 state and local government employee layoffs in the next two years.

Speaker: Scott Walker
Statement: The state is able to sharply curtail contract bargaining rights for state employee unions.
PolitiFact explanations: The state set up the rules, so it can change them

Statement: Since I took office, Wisconsin now has the 2nd highest health care quality ranking in the country.
PolitiFact explanations: Aside from one-year blip, rating has been consistently high

Speaker: Scott Walker

Speaker: Scott Walker
Statement: My support from young voters -- those 18 to 24 -- in November 2014 was "largely unheard of for a Republican."

Statement: Americans will spend more on taxes in 2015 than on food, clothing and housing combined.

Speaker: Scott Walker
Statement: The woman named Wisconsins 2010 "outstanding teacher of the year" was laid off by the Milwaukee Public Schools that year under "seniority and tenure rules" that were eliminated by his Act 10 changes.

Speaker: Scott Walker
Statement: Wisconsin requires, "by law, a photo ID to vote."

Statement: Says opponent Mary Burke says she "supports Obamacare unequivocally and wants to expand it."

Statement: Under his leadership, more people in Wisconsin "have access to health care."

Statement: Our ranking in terms of the best and worst states to do business in was 43 four years ago, and we just moved up to 17 two weeks ago.

Statement: Says that even if his budget is adopted, private schools in the choice program would be getting about half the per-pupil funds that public schools receive

Speaker: Scott Walker
Statement: Under my predecessor, they cut funding for education, but they didn't give them anything in return to make up for that, leading to "less money" for school districts
PolitiFact explanations: Last guv gave them ability to tax for it

Statement: Thanks to our policies, "for the first time in state history, we have put millions of dollars into our rainy day fund in consecutive years."

Statement: Says 94 percent of Wisconsin employers think the state "is heading in the right direction" and a majority say they will "grow their companies in 2012."

Statement: We wiped out a $3.6 billion deficit without raising taxes.
PolitiFact explanations: Yes and no.

Speaker: Scott Walker
Statement: Says critics who say he cut Medicaid are wrong; his budget added $1.2 billion to the program

Statement: Our county now has the fastest growing airport in America, attracting nearly 1,000 new private sector jobs.

Speaker: Scott Walker
Statement: Wisconsin is one of the highest taxed states in the nation.

Speaker: Scott Walker

Speaker: Scott Walker
Statement: Says under his leadership "Wisconsin median household income" is up 2.7%, while it is down 1.3% nationally under President Obama.

Statement: Says the recall elections that aimed to remove him and other Republican officials from office "cost tens of millions of dollars to run."
PolitiFact explanations: Costs sizeable, but only $16 million

PolitiFact explanations: Less than Walker claims -- and less than increases before Obama took office

Speaker: Scott Walker
Statement: The difference over the (previous) four years between where things were headed and where we brought them to over the last four years is a total of $816 in saved property tax money.

Speaker: Scott Walker
Statement: In "the past four or five" presidential elections, "people who poll high at the beginning are not the people who end up being the nominees."

Statement: The projected $1.8 billion state budget shortfall for 2015-17 "actually comes from an assumption based on zero growth. That just doesnt happen."

Statement: Wisconsin ranks No. 2 in economic growth, according to the Federal Reserve Bank of Philadelphia.
PolitiFact explanations: Economy may be improving, but there's no ranking

Statement: Says potential Democratic opponent Mary Burke "implemented the policies of Jim Doyle. Those are the policies that, in his last term, saw the state lose more than 133,000 jobs."

Speaker: Scott Walker
Statement: Says the success of his economic agenda is supported by the fact "we went from unemployment at 9.2 percent when I decided to run for governor four years ago to two points lower."

Speaker: Scott Walker
Statement: Says he first unveiled his new legislative agenda in Wisconsin, not in California as critics complain

Speaker: Scott Walker
Statement: Overwhelming Democrat and Republican votes in 2011 for legislation in two special sessions on jobs demonstrated the bipartisan nature of the Wisconsin Legislature.

Speaker: Scott Walker
Statement: Since Scott Walker took office as governor in January 2011, there has been an increase of 33,200 jobs in Wisconsin.

Statement: Says Democratic recall opponent Tom Barrett is campaigning on "lifting property tax" limits.

Statement: The Wisconsin law repealed by Republicans, which allowed discriminated workers to sue in state court, "was kind of a gravy train" for lawyers.

Speaker: Scott Walker
Statement: We've seen local union after local union rush to their school boards, their city councils, their technical school boards and rush through contracts in the past two weeks that had no contributions to the pension and no contribution to health care.

Speaker: Scott Walker
Statement: Eliminating the state tax on health savings accounts will "make it easier for small business owners to provide health insurance to their employees."

Speaker: Scott Walker
Statement: In Congress Tom Barrett voted to allow abortions through the ninth month, just moments before the baby is born.
PolitiFact explanations: Partial birth ban applied to a specific procedure. It's the Supreme Court, not Congress, that voted to allow late-term abortions

Speaker: Scott Walker
Statement: Says Gov. Jim Doyle and the DNR have not put hunters first and mismanaged the deer herd; as a result "the deer population has dwindled."
PolitiFact explanations: There may be fewer deer in the woods, but it's by design (there are fewer to crash into your car, too)

Speaker: Scott Walker
Statement: As Milwaukee County executive, Scott Walker "eliminated the waiting list for long-term care for older adults through the Family Care program."
PolitiFact explanations: It did disappear within weeks of Walker taking office ... but due to things already in place

Speaker: Scott Walker
Statement: Since being elected, (Tom Barrett) has dumped 8.2 billion gallons of raw sewage into Lake Michigan.
PolitiFact explanations: That's a lot of flushing! And all by one guy?

Speaker: Scott Walker
Statement: Says his political opponents "brought 100,000 protesters into our state."
PolitiFact explanations: No evidence that vast majority weren't from Wisconsin

Speaker: Scott Walker
Statement: Says Thomas Jefferson said "that government is best which governs least."
PolitiFact explanations: It's often misattributed

Speaker: Scott Walker
Statement: Says that as president, Barack Obama has not gone to the Texas-Mexico border
PolitiFact explanations: Except for that speech at the border in 2011

Speaker: Scott Walker
Statement: Minnesotas "advantage" in economic growth has been having "Republicans in charge of at least one part of government" for all but two years, while Wisconsin Democrats "for many years" before 2011 controlled both legislative chambers and the governorship.

Speaker: Scott Walker
Statement: I unsealed my records at Marquette University.
PolitiFact explanations: We haven't seen any documents, just statements

Speaker: Scott Walker
Statement: The University of Wisconsin System "will be much more affordable than just about any other campus in America" because "going forward we have a cap on it tied to inflation."
PolitiFact explanations: On average, we're average

Speaker: Scott Walker
Statement: My opponent supported policies that increased tuition by 18 percent.
PolitiFact explanations: She wasn't Chancellor Burke

Speaker: Scott Walker
Statement: The next state budget will begin with a surplus of over half a billion dollars -- $535 million to be exact.
PolitiFact explanations: As of now, a "structural deficit" is projected

Speaker: Scott Walker
Statement: In the last year, Wisconsin ranked third in Midwest job growth.
PolitiFact explanations: Not any more

Speaker: Scott Walker
Statement: Mary Burke "wasted 12.5 million dollars on a vacant lot" in a move that "could cost taxpayers nearly $25 million."
PolitiFact explanations: Must be that new new math

Speaker: Scott Walker
Statement: When Jim Doyle was governor and Mary Burke was commerce secretary, Wisconsin saw "billions in middle-class tax hikes on nursing home beds, gas, phones and garbage."
PolitiFact explanations: Millions

Speaker: Scott Walker
Statement: Says the secret John Doe criminal investigation of his campaign has been "resolved" and two judges have said it is "over."
PolitiFact explanations: More judicial rulings ahead

Speaker: Scott Walker
Statement: A poll taken "a few months ago" found "70 percent approval or higher" for the Act 10 collective bargaining law.

Speaker: Scott Walker
Statement: Federal government reneging on Medicaid payments to Wisconsin caused about $240 million in extra costs in the 2013-15 state budget.
PolitiFact explanations: No broken promises

Speaker: Scott Walker
Statement: Jobs that involve the minimum wage are overwhelmingly jobs for young people starting out in the workforce.
PolitiFact explanations: Mix of ages at low wages

Speaker: Scott Walker
Statement: Protesters in La Crosse blocked an exit and surrounded a State Patrol car carrying the governor and were "beating on the windows and rocking the vehicle." When the car was "extricated" from the crowd, a truck blocked a second exit.

Speaker: Scott Walker
Statement: We are experiencing the worst economic recovery America has ever had.
PolitiFact explanations: A slow recovery, but not the worst ever

Speaker: Scott Walker
Statement: Says that in his first two years, "Wisconsin has seen its best two-year job growth in a decade."
PolitiFact explanations: Turnaround began a year before his arrival

Speaker: Scott Walker
Statement: Obama for President and Baldwin for Senate have kept their campaign offices up and running in Fox Valley, Eau Claire and La Crosse with their staffs preparing for the next battle.
PolitiFact explanations: Only if up and running means closed

Speaker: Scott Walker
Statement: A study showed that President Barack Obamas health-care reforms will "devastate Wisconsin" by pushing people off employer-sponsored insurance, driving up premiums, increasing dependency and making 122,000 people ineligible for Medicaid.

Speaker: Scott Walker
Statement: Says new figures he released showing Wisconsin job gains for 2011 are "the final job numbers."
PolitiFact explanations: Still need federal review

Speaker: Scott Walker
Statement: We gave every public employee in the state the freedom to choose whether or not they want to be in a union.
PolitiFact explanations: Except for those unions exempt from the changes

Speaker: Scott Walker
Statement: Says recall organizers "started their website last November" and began work on their effort before he even took office.
PolitiFact explanations: One man and a domain registration does not a recall make

Speaker: Scott Walker
Statement: The St. Norbert College/Wisconsin Public Radio poll has "been wrong in almost every election."
PolitiFact explanations: He may not like the result of the latest, but the polls been consistent

Speaker: Scott Walker
Statement: The overwhelming number of school districts reported their staff stayed the same or grew after the 2011-13 state budget
PolitiFact explanations: Fuzzy math turns reality on its head

Speaker: Scott Walker
Statement: The largest category of people coming into the technical schools in Wisconsin are people with four-year degrees.
PolitiFact explanations: High school grads still #1

Speaker: Scott Walker
Statement: Under our (2011-13) budget, the average (Wisconsin) property taxpayer will save $700.
PolitiFact explanations: Misleading claim based on favorable assumptions

Speaker: Scott Walker
Statement: Says many public-employee unions falsely told their Wisconsin members his budget-repair bill sought 12 percent to 13 percent of their incomes for health insurance premiums.
PolitiFact explanations: No evidence unions embellished the impact

Speaker: Scott Walker
Statement: Two years ago we had "the largest structural deficit ever in Wisconsin."
PolitiFact explanations: Wrong by seven years and one political party

Speaker: Scott Walker
Statement: Were broke. We dont have any more money.
PolitiFact explanations: As a political argument, it may work. But as a financial one? Experts say not so much

Speaker: Scott Walker
Statement: The things I said (during the prank call by a blogger posing as GOP contributor David Koch) are the things Ive said publicly all along about the Wisconsin budget debate.
PolitiFact explanations: In unguarded conversation, some strategies and new information emerged

Speaker: Scott Walker
Statement: When it comes to protesters in Madison, "almost all" are now from outside of Wisconsin.
PolitiFact explanations: Law enforcement in Madison doesn't see it that way

Speaker: Scott Walker
Statement: I campaigned on (the proposals in the budget repair bill for Wisconsin) all throughout the election. Anybody who says they are shocked on this has been asleep for the past two years.
PolitiFact explanations: For a campaign built on specifics, there were none to suggest the scope of his proposal

Speaker: Scott Walker
Statement: The alternative to higher state worker pension and health care payments "is to look at 1,500 layoffs of state employees or close to 200,000 children who would be bumped off Medicaid-related programs."

Statement: 98 percent of American families make "under $250,000 a year."

Statement: The United States has "one of the highest corporate tax rates in the world."

Statement: Teddy Roosevelt first called for (health care) reform nearly a century ago.

Statement: We are making the largest investment in education in our nations history.

Statement: Putting three Republicans in my Cabinet...is unprecedented.

Statement: Under Barack Obama's health care proposal, "if you've got a health care plan that you like, you can keep it."

Statement: Senator McCain has been talking tough about earmarks, and that's good, but earmarks account for about $18-billion of our budget.

Statement: John McCain wants to "give oil companies another $4-billion" in tax breaks.

Statement: John McCain has voted with George Bush 90 percent of the time.

Statement: Today, we import triple the amount of oil than we had on the day Senator McCain took office.

Statement: McCain opposed a requirement that the government buy American-made motorcycles. And he said all buy-American provisions were quote 'disgraceful.'

Statement: We could save all the oil that they're talking about getting off drilling, if everybody was just inflating their tires and getting regular tune-ups.

Statement: Obama said his proposed $1,000 emergency energy rebate "will be enough to offset the increased cost of gas for a working family over the next 4 months."

Statement: Wild Bill Hickok had his first duel in the town square here. And the family legend is that he is a distant cousin of mine.

Statement: McCain has switched to Obama's position on more troops to Afghanistan.

Statement: More than half of all black children live in single-parent households, a number that has doubled  doubled  since we were children.

Statement: Says he and Mitt Romney agreed on tying minimum wage increases to inflation.

Statement: We supported the first new nuclear power plant in three decades.

Statement: Right now, American oil production is the highest that its been in eight years.

Statement: Eighty percent of the American people support an approach (to federal budget problems) that includes revenues and includes cuts.

Statement: As we've seen that federal support for states diminish, you've seen the biggest job losses in the public sector -- teachers, police officers, firefighters losing their jobs.

Speaker: Barack Obama
Statement: You see a whole bunch of Korean cars here in the United States, and you don't see any American cars in Korea.

Statement: If you're a  wealthy CEO or a  hedge fund manager in America right now, your taxes are  lower than they've been since the 1950s.

Statement: Says "we have now more Border Patrol officers  than weve had at any time in our history."

Speaker: Barack Obama

Statement: I lowered taxes over the last two years.

Statement: McCain, "voted against renewable sources of energy, against biofuels, against solar power, against wind power.... "

Statement: McCain lobbied for (a) $10-million pork project honoring conservative justice.

The vast majority of the money I got was from small donors all across the country.''	Big donors bankrolled much of Obama's campaign	/truth-o-meter/statements/2010/apr/22/barack-obama/obama-campaign-financed-large-donors-too/	
Barack Obama	4	We've excluded lobbyists from policymaking jobs."
